doc.after: Tiruchirappalli is situated in central south-eastern India, almost at the geographic centre of the state of Tamil Nadu. The Kaveri Delta begins to form 16 kilometres (9.9Â mi) west of the city where the river divides into two streamsâthe Kaveri and the Kollidamâto form the island of Srirangam.[64][79][80] By road it is 912 kilometres (567Â mi) south of Hyderabad, 322 kilometres (200Â mi) south-west of Chennai and 341 kilometres (212Â mi) south-east of Bangalore.[81] The topology of Tiruchirappalli is almost flat, with an average elevation of 88 metres (289Â ft). A few isolated hillocks rise above the surface,[82] the highest of which is the Rockfort;[83][84] its estimated age of 3,800 million years makes it one of the oldest rocks in the world.[85][86] Other prominent hillocks include the Golden Rock, Khajamalai,[87] and one each at Uyyakondan Thirumalai and Thiruverumbur.[88]
